intro: Calpocalyx brevibracteatus, commonly known as the short-bract calpocalyx, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa, characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, woolly flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Calpocalyx brevibracteatus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
